title: Around the clock in Europe;
author: Howell, Charles Fish.
snippet: the "Inner House" or "Outer House,** and possibly the Lord President himself. Otherwise he can take note of the uninviting shop-windows and the piles of merchandise  on the sidewalks, and find entertainment in such unfamiliar signs as " provisioners," "spirit merchants,"  "bootmakers," "hairdressers," etc., with prices set forth in shillings and pence, or rejoice in a hostelry with so unusual a name as "The Black Bull Lodgings for Travellers and Working Men.*'

title: Around the clock in Europe :
author: Howell, Charles Fish
snippet: the "Inner House" or "Outer House," and possibly the Lord President himself. Otherwise he can take note of the uninviting shop-windows and the piles of merchandise  on the sidewalks, and find entertainment in such unfamiliar signs as "provisioners," "spirit merchants,"  "bootmakers," "hairdressers," etc., with prices set forth in shillings and pence, or rejoice in a hostelry with so unusual a name as "The Black Bull Lodgings for Travellers and Working Men."

title: May Margaret,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: What was the end of cousin Will's devotion and single-heart service to his love and his lady? The Black Bull's Head on the board of Edinburgh Castle will answer you that.'
